quest.name: Resolve Unshaken
journal: The knowing look in Mikoto's eyes suggests it may be time to get to work.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Certain decisions made during the course of this quest will affect the story in subsequent quests. These decisions cannot be changed once this quest is completed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note, however, that these decisions will not affect rewards received upon quest completion.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Sorry to have kept you waiting, Forename. We have finally found a suitable location for the Ironworks' device.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: And you'll be pleased to hear the D.A.M.'s are ready to go. Some of our finest work yet, if I do say so myself.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Once in place, Bajsaljen has asked we redirect the aether currents to the newly secured outpost.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I will mark on your map the location where the device must be set.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: When you have finished, contact us via this linkpearl and we shall handle the rest.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I shall pray for your safe return, Forename.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)The D.A.M. is ready, Forename. Readying transmission protocols now.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)All systems appear to be normal. Can you confirm the D.A.M. has burrowed into the ground?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Then everything is as it should be. You're free to return to camp.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Welcome back. The D.A.M.'s appear to be working as planned, though it will take some time for the diversion of the aether current to be complete.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: We will continue to monitor the situation from here. Should the D.A.M.'s be in need of fine-tuning, however, we may have to call on you again.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Sensors indicate faint traces of aether drifting toward the designated location, and the energy signature is growing stronger. Before long, we'll have made a brand-new current leading straight to the outpost!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Mikoto, nooo!!!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Mikoto...? It's another vision, isn't it?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: And you saw it too, didn't you? What is it? What did you see?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It's nothing, Lilja. Really. Just a dizzy spell, is all. I will be fine after a short rest.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Mikoto, there's no need to put on a brave face. You said before these visions of yours can't be changed, but... That doesn't mean we can't help.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: That's very kind of you, Lilja, but I promise you I'm fine. For now, let's all concentrate on the task at hand.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: All right... But if you ever need to talk, I'll be right here.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I understand your concern, truly. But even if we were to tell the others, there is nothing they can do to change what I sawâ”€what we saw.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No battle is won without sacrifice, and I have made peace with what is to come.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I imagine Moenbryda was very much the same in her last moments. She never turned her eyes from the truth, the inevitable, no matter how harsh it may be. It is a quality you both share, and one I strive to emulate.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Come now, Forename, let's not assume the worst. After all, we know naught of what happens before or after that brief glimpse into the future.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Thanks again for your help with the D.A.M. Once the new outpost is secure, you can be certain we'll get to work right away on erecting a barrier.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text:
In the meantime, perhaps you'd be willing to share what you and Mikoto saw...?
On second thought, forget I said anything. Like she said, it's all fine. Let's get back to it, eh?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Ah, speaking of getting to work, I think Bajsaljen was asking after you. Probably wants to talk strategy before their next mission.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. Thank you for coming. I wished to speak with you about Misija.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: As you may recall, it was my intention to have her stand trial once the IVth Legion was routed, and Bozja's lands made secure. But there are those who demand we make an example of her, and the cries for her execution grow louder by the day.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It is my belief that we must first establish a rule of law, where those convicted of crimes may be given due process. In the case of imperial captives, an exchange of prisoners should be considered a viable alternative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I do not deny that the crimes she has committed are grave indeed. Yet the fact remains, Misija was a soldier, working under the orders of Gabranth and the IVth Legion. I am hesitant to carry out so harsh a judgment when it is her superiors who should be held accountable.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But such is the nature of war... Soldiers forced to perform terrible, terrible deeds at the behest of a select few. As commander, I know all too well the weight my orders carry. The day may come that I am made to answer for the acts committed in my name.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But today, it is Misija who stands accused. Gabranth has yet to be brought before us, and the people demand justice be served, one way or another.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll not deny she has a troubled past, but if it were up to me... I would put her to death.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I agree with you, Bajsaljen. The blame lies with Menenius and Gabranth.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: It's not my place to give counsel on such grave matters, but I trust you will make the right decision.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: When the time comes, I will keep your words in mind. Thank you, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Why the furrowed brow? Was it something Bajsaljen said?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: ...Sorry, I shouldn't pry. I'll get back to work.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Dmitar after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.
